title: Flipped Learning-Based Applied Engineering Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of college-level foundational mathematics (calculus, linear algebra)
context.additional_context: A course for a learner group composed of current professionals to systematically acquire mathematical approaches for engineering problem-solving. Customized training for corporate R&D departments.

learning_goals: Learners accurately apply core calculus and linear algebra concepts for engineering problem-solving at 85% proficiency or higher
In flipped learning environments, learners engage in peer feedback-based problem-solving activities at least twice weekly
Learners connect 70% or more of learned mathematical theories to real-world work applications (structural analysis, signal processing, etc.)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
